author: Chukwuma Iwundu, Clare MacRae, EleftheriaÂ Vasileiou
definition:
- Not found code search
- Not available
implementation:
These codes are not intended to be mandatory, but are to be used as a starting point for the identification of Acute Bronchiolitis in routine Electronic Health Record (EHR). Each study may differ in the sensitivity and specificity of the coding required.  

 

According to the National Health Service (NHS), Bronchiolitis is defined as a common lower respiratory tract infection that affects babies and young children under 2 years old.

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/bronchiolitis/

 

According to the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) guidelines, a Bronchiolitis diagnosis can me made if the child has a coryzal prodrome lasting 1 to 3 days, followed by: persistent cough and either tachypnoea or chest recession (or both) and either wheeze or crackles on chest auscultation (or both). 

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/ng9/chapter/Key-priorities-for-implementation

 

It is therefore recommended that these codes are used for individuals with a respiratory tract infection restricted to lower respiratory tract in young children under 2 years old. 

Not found code search
publications: Publications in 2020-2021 identified in PubMed

Reyburn R, Tuivaga E, Nguyen CD, Ratu FT, Nand D, Kado J, Tikoduadua L, Jenkins K, de Campo M, Kama M, Devi R, Rafai E, Weinberger DM, Mulholland EK, Russell FM. Effect of ten-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine introduction on pneumonia hospital admissions in Fiji: a time-series analysis. Lancet Glob Health. 2021 Jan;9(1):e91-e98. doi: 10.1016/S2214-109X(20)30421-6. Epub 2020 Nov 20. PMID: 33227258.
